sentence: She said that she would call me later.
note: Backshift will → would after a past reporting verb.

sentence: The man who lives next door is a doctor.
note: Use 'who' for people in defining clauses.

sentence: If it rains, we will stay at home.
note: If + present, will + base for real future results.

sentence: If I had more time, I would learn another language.
tr: Daha fazla zamanım olsaydı başka bir dil öğrenirdim.
note: If + past, would + base for unreal present.

sentence: If you had called me, I would have helped.
note: If + past perfect, would have + V3 for unreal past.
Be + V3 to focus on the action, not the doer.

sentence: I had my laptop repaired last week.
tr: Geçen hafta dizüstü bilgisayarımı tamir ettirdim.
note: Have/get + object + V3 shows arranging a service.

sentence: He must have missed the train.
note: Must + have + V3 = strong belief about the past.

sentence: It was Sarah who solved the problem.
Feeling tired, he decided to rest.
note: -ing clause shares the subject with the main clause.
